descr: "Describes the event of a patient being administered a vaccination or a record of a vaccination as reported by a patient, a clinician or another party and may include vaccine reaction information and what vaccination protocol was followed."

fields.name: resourceType
fields.descr: "This is a Immunization resource"

fields.name: identifier
fields.descr: "A unique identifier assigned to this immunization record."

fields.name: status
fields.descr: "Indicates the current status of the vaccination event."

fields.name: notGiven
fields.descr: "Indicates if the vaccination was or was not given."

fields.name: vaccineCode
fields.descr: "Vaccine that was administered or was to be administered."

fields.name: patient
fields.descr: "The patient who either received or did not receive the immunization."

fields.name: encounter
fields.descr: "The visit or admission or other contact between patient and health care provider the immunization was performed as part of."

fields.name: date
fields.descr: "Date vaccine administered or was to be administered."

fields.name: primarySource
fields.descr: "An indication that the content of the record is based on information from the person who administered the vaccine. This reflects the context under which the data was originally recorded."

fields.name: reportOrigin
fields.descr: "The source of the data when the report of the immunization event is not based on information from the person who administered the vaccine."

fields.name: location
fields.descr: "The service delivery location where the vaccine administration occurred."

fields.name: manufacturer
fields.descr: "Name of vaccine manufacturer."

fields.name: lotNumber
fields.descr: "Lot number of the  vaccine product."

fields.name: expirationDate
fields.descr: "Date vaccine batch expires."

fields.name: site
fields.descr: "Body site where vaccine was administered."

fields.name: route
fields.descr: "The path by which the vaccine product is taken into the body."

fields.name: doseQuantity
fields.descr: "The quantity of vaccine product that was administered."

fields.name: practitioner
fields.descr: "Indicates who or what performed the event."

fields.name: note
fields.descr: "Extra information about the immunization that is not conveyed by the other attributes."

fields.name: explanation
fields.descr: "Reasons why a vaccine was or was not administered."

fields.name: reaction
fields.descr: "Categorical data indicating that an adverse event is associated in time to an immunization."

fields.name: vaccinationProtocol
fields.descr: "Contains information about the protocol(s) under which the vaccine was administered."

fields.name: text
fields.descr:
"A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it \"clinically safe\" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.descr:
"These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope."

"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions."

fields.descr:
"The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes."
